overview_of_class: This course aims to provide a rigorous analysis of key aspects of collective decision making. The first part focuses on social choice theory, or how individual preferences are aggregated to form a collective preference and determine a collective decision. The second part of the course analyzes the link between politician motivations and policy outcomes. In the last part of the course, the formal framework developed in early parts is applied to major policy issues: redistribution, pensions, and regional transfers.
name: Political Economics
title: WCAS ECON 335-0-20 Political Economics

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
